title: Authors and Citation
text: Sarapas C (2025). lighthouse.codebook: Summarize Datasets Lighthouse Institute Projects. R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/ccsarapas/lighthouse.codebook.
code: @Manual{,   title = {lighthouse.codebook: Summarize Datasets for Lighthouse Institute Projects},   author = {Casey Sarapas},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://github.com/ccsarapas/lighthouse.codebook}, }

what: Summarize Datasets for Lighthouse Institute Projects
title: Summarize Datasets for Lighthouse Institute Projects
text: lighthouse.codebook package includes tools summarizing datasets used staff Lighthouse Institute, research division Chestnut Health Systems.

title: Summarize Datasets for Lighthouse Institute Projects
text: Install lighthouse.codebook running:

title: Generate a codebook object — cb_create
text: cb_create() builds object class "li_codebook" dataset optional metadata. resulting object can used write Excel workbook variable data summaries (using cb_write()), extract processed data (cb_get_data()), generate dataset summaries (cb_summarize_numeric() cb_summarize_categorical()).

title: Generate a codebook object — cb_create
code: cb_create(   data,   metadata = NULL,   ...,   .name = name,   .var_label = label,   .val_labels = val_labels,   .user_missing = NULL,   .val_labs_sep1 = NULL,   .val_labs_sep2 = NULL,   .rmv_html = !name,   .rmv_line_breaks = !name,   .user_missing_col = c("if_any", "yes", "no"),   .user_missing_conflict = c("metadata", "missing_label"),   .user_missing_incompatible = c("ignore", "warn", "error") )

title: Generate a codebook object — cb_create
text: data data frame exported retrieved REDCap. metadata data frame containing metadata, variable labels value labels. ... Additional columns metadata preserve final codebook. New names can assigned passing named arguments. Columns variable name, form, variable label, value labels included default. .name, .var_label, .val_labels Columns metadata containing variable name, variable label, value labels, respectively. metadata provided, .name must specified. .var_label .val_labels may set NULL omit. .user_missing formula list formulas specifying user missing values. Formulas specify variables left-hand side (variable names tidyselect expressions), missing values right-hand side. left-hand side omitted, defaults tidyselect::everything(). See "Specifying user missing values" examples. .val_labs_sep1, .val_labs_sep2 Regex patterns separating value labels metadata. .val_labs_sep1 separates values labels, .val_labs_sep2 separates value/label pairs. e.g., value labels format "1, First label|2, Second label", set .val_labs_sep1 "," .val_labs_sep2 "\\|". .rmv_html <tidy-select> Codebook columns HTML tags removed. .rmv_line_breaks <tidy-select> Codebook columns line breaks removed. .user_missing_col Include value labels user missing values separate column? default, "if_any", adds column user missings specified least one variable. .user_missing_conflict different labels value provided metadata user missings, used? .user_missing_incompatible handle variables specified .user_missing compatible user missing values (e.g., logical, Date, POSIXt)?

title: Generate a codebook object — cb_create
text: "li_codebook" object, consisting (1) tibble summarizing passed dataset (2) attributes containing passed dataset (several formats) additional metadata. Specifically: tibble columns: name: variable name type: variable type label: variable label value_labels: value labels user_missing: optional column, depending value .user_missing_col, value labels user missing values missing: proportion missing additional columns specified ... Attributes: Transformed versions passed dataset. See cb_get_data(). Lookup tables metadata used internally: "user_missing", "vals_by_label", "labs_by_value", "miss_propagate", "factors", "n_obs", "n_vars"

title: Generate a codebook object — cb_create
text: User missing values defined passing formula list formulas .user_missing argument. Formulas specify variables left-hand side user missing values variables right-hand side: user missings can applied multiple variables using tidyselect expressions. Different user missings can applied different variables using list formulas: User missing values may optionally named set value labels: labels set .user_missing conflict metadata, .user_missing_conflict controls labels used. User missing values compatible logical, date, datetime (POSIXt) variables. default, variables ignored specified .user_missing. (.e., user missing values applied compatible variables.) behavior can changed using .user_missing_incompatible argument.
code: cb <- cb_create_redcap(data, metadata, .user_missing = var1 ~ 99) # for variables `var1` through `var5` .user_missing = var1:var5 ~ 99  # for all numeric variables, plus `var6` and `var7` .user_missing = c(where(is.numeric), var6, var7) ~ c(-9, -8, -7)  # omitted left-hand side defaults to `tidyselect::everything()` .user_missing = ~ -99 .user_missing = list(   starts_with("status") ~ c(98, 99),   var7:var10 ~ 97 ) .user_missing = ~ c(Declined = -98, "Not applicable" = -99)

title: Generate a codebook object — cb_create
code: diamonds2 <- ggplot2::diamonds |>   transform(     carat_group = as.integer(cut(carat, breaks = 3, labels = 1:3)),     price_group = as.integer(cut(       price,       breaks = c(0, 500, 1000, 2000, 5000, 10000, Inf),       labels = 1:6,       right = FALSE     ))   )  # basic codebook cb_create(diamonds2) #> # A tibble: 12 × 4 #>    name        type    value_labels                           missing #>    <chr>       <chr>   <chr>                                    <dbl> #>  1 carat       numeric NA                                           0 #>  2 cut         ordered Fair; Good; Very Good; Premium; Ideal        0 #>  3 color       ordered D; E; F; G; H; I; J                          0 #>  4 clarity     ordered I1; SI2; SI1; VS2; VS1; VVS2; VVS1; IF       0 #>  5 depth       numeric NA                                           0 #>  6 table       numeric NA                                           0 #>  7 price       integer NA                                           0 #>  8 x           numeric NA                                           0 #>  9 y           numeric NA                                           0 #> 10 z           numeric NA                                           0 #> 11 carat_group integer NA                                           0 #> 12 price_group integer NA                                           0  # convert variables to factor to treat as categorical diamonds2 |>   transform(     carat_group = factor(carat_group),     price_group = factor(price_group)   ) |>    cb_create() #> # A tibble: 12 × 4 #>    name        type    value_labels                           missing #>    <chr>       <chr>   <chr>                                    <dbl> #>  1 carat       numeric NA                                           0 #>  2 cut         ordered Fair; Good; Very Good; Premium; Ideal        0 #>  3 color       ordered D; E; F; G; H; I; J                          0 #>  4 clarity     ordered I1; SI2; SI1; VS2; VS1; VVS2; VVS1; IF       0 #>  5 depth       numeric NA                                           0 #>  6 table       numeric NA                                           0 #>  7 price       integer NA                                           0 #>  8 x           numeric NA                                           0 #>  9 y           numeric NA                                           0 #> 10 z           numeric NA                                           0 #> 11 carat_group factor  1; 2; 3                                      0 #> 12 price_group factor  1; 2; 3; 4; 5; 6                             0  # provide metadata for variable and value labels diamonds_meta <- data.frame(   name = names(diamonds2),   label = c(     # from ?ggplot2::diamonds     "price in US dollars ($326–$18,823)",     "weight of the diamond (0.2–5.01)",     "quality of the cut (Fair, Good, Very Good, Premium, Ideal)",     "diamond colour, from D (best) to J (worst)",     "a measurement of how clear the diamond is (I1 (worst), SI2, SI1, VS2, VS1, VVS2, VVS1, IF (best))",     "length in mm (0–10.74)",     "width in mm (0–58.9)",     "depth in mm (0–31.8)",     "total depth percentage = z / mean(x, y) = 2 * z / (x + y) (43–79)",     "width of top of diamond relative to widest point (43–95)",     "diamond carat (3 groups)",     "diamond price (6 groups)"   ),   val_labels = c(     rep(NA, 10),     "1 = small; 2 = medium; 3 = large",     "1 = <$500; 2 = $500-$999; 3 = $1,000-$1,999; 4 = $2,000-$4,999; 5 = $5,000-$9,999; 6 = $10,000+"   ) )  cb_create(   diamonds2, diamonds_meta,   .val_labs_sep1 = " = ", .val_labs_sep2 = "; " ) #> # A tibble: 12 × 5 #>    name        type    label                                value_labels missing #>    <chr>       <chr>   <chr>                                <chr>          <dbl> #>  1 carat       numeric price in US dollars ($326–$18,823)   NA                 0 #>  2 cut         ordered weight of the diamond (0.2–5.01)     Fair; Good;…       0 #>  3 color       ordered quality of the cut (Fair, Good, Ver… D; E; F; G;…       0 #>  4 clarity     ordered diamond colour, from D (best) to J … I1; SI2; SI…       0 #>  5 depth       numeric a measurement of how clear the diam… NA                 0 #>  6 table       numeric length in mm (0–10.74)               NA                 0 #>  7 price       integer width in mm (0–58.9)                 NA                 0 #>  8 x           numeric depth in mm (0–31.8)                 NA                 0 #>  9 y           numeric total depth percentage = z / mean(x… NA                 0 #> 10 z           numeric width of top of diamond relative to… NA                 0 #> 11 carat_group factor  diamond carat (3 groups)             [1] small; …       0 #> 12 price_group factor  diamond price (6 groups)             [1] <$500; …       0

what: Generate a codebook object from REDCap data — cb_create_redcap
title: Generate a codebook object from REDCap data — cb_create_redcap
text: cb_create_redcap() builds object class "li_codebook" dataset corresponding codebook exported REDCap. resulting object can used write Excel workbook variable data summaries (using cb_write()), extract processed data (cb_get_data()), generate dataset summaries (cb_summarize_numeric() cb_summarize_categorical()). variant cb_create() includes functionality specific REDCap data metadata, including: Defaults typical REDCap metadata column names Includes form field default Unpacking, labelling, optional missing propagation checkbox data Optional coercion character variables marked "integer" metedata$text_validation_type_or_show_slider_number

title: Generate a codebook object from REDCap data — cb_create_redcap
code: cb_create_redcap(   data,   metadata,   ...,   .name = field_name,   .var_label = field_label,   .val_labels = select_choices_or_calculations,   .form = form_name,   .user_missing = NULL,   .val_labs_sep1 = ", ",   .val_labs_sep2 = "\\|",   .rmv_html = !name,   .rmv_line_breaks = !name,   .coerce_integers = TRUE,   .checkbox_resp_values = FALSE,   .propagate_checkbox_missings = TRUE,   .user_missing_col = c("if_any", "yes", "no"),   .user_missing_conflict = c("metadata", "missing_label"),   .user_missing_incompatible = c("ignore", "warn", "error") )

title: Generate a codebook object from REDCap data — cb_create_redcap
text: data data frame exported retrieved REDCap. metadata data frame containing REDCap codebook associated data. ... Additional columns metadata preserve final codebook. New names can assigned passing named arguments. Columns variable name, form, variable label, value labels included default. .name, .var_label, .val_labels Columns metadata containing variable name, variable label, value labels, respectively. .form Column metadata containing form names. (Set NULL omit.) .user_missing formula list formulas specifying user missing values. Formulas specify variables left-hand side (variable names tidyselect expressions), missing values right-hand side. left-hand side omitted, defaults tidyselect::everything(). See "Specifying user missing values" cb_create() documentation  examples. .val_labs_sep1, .val_labs_sep2 Regex patterns separating value labels metadata. .val_labs_sep1 separates values labels, .val_labs_sep2 separates value/label pairs. e.g., value labels format "1, First label|2, Second label", set .val_labs_sep1 "," .val_labs_sep2 "\\|". .rmv_html <tidy-select> Codebook columns HTML tags removed. .rmv_line_breaks <tidy-select> Codebook columns line breaks removed. .coerce_integers variables listed "integer" metedata$text_validation_type_or_show_slider_number coerced integer? .checkbox_resp_values checkbox values use labels metadata (TRUE) "Yes" / "" (FALSE)? See "Checkbox data handling" . .propagate_checkbox_missings user missing values checkbox group propagated across variables group? See "Checkbox data handling" . .user_missing_col Include value labels user missing values separate column? default, "if_any", adds column user missings specified least one variable. .user_missing_conflict different labels value provided metadata user missings, used? .user_missing_incompatible handle variables specified .user_missing compatible user missing values (e.g., logical, Date, POSIXt)?

title: Generate a codebook object from REDCap data — cb_create_redcap
text: "li_codebook" object, consisting (1) tibble summarizing passed dataset (2) attributes containing passed dataset (several formats) additional metadata. Specifically: tibble columns: name: variable name form: form name type: variable type label: variable label value_labels: value labels user_missing: optional column, depending value .user_missing_col, value labels user missing values missing: proportion missing additional columns specified ... Attributes: Transformed versions passed dataset. See cb_get_data(). Lookup tables metadata used internally: "user_missing", "vals_by_label", "labs_by_value", "miss_propagate", "factors", "n_obs", "n_vars"

title: Generate a codebook object from REDCap data — cb_create_redcap
text: Data REDCap checkboxes yields one variable dataset response option. labelled generically "Yes" "", unless .checkbox_resp_values TRUE, case response-specific labels metadata used. example, checkbox group options "past year," "year ago," "Never," corresponding variables chk_var1___0, chk_var1___1, chk_var1___2: .checkbox_resp_values FALSE, values: chk_var1___0, chk_var1___1, chk_var1___2: 0 = ""; 1 =  "Yes". .checkbox_resp_values TRUE, variable unique labels: chk_var1___0: 0 = "selected," 1 = "past year" chk_var1___1: 0 = "selected," 1 = "year ago" chk_var1___2: 0 = "selected," 0 = "Never"

title: Generate a codebook object from REDCap data — cb_create_redcap
text: .propagate_checkbox_missings TRUE, missing values checkbox group variable propagated variables group. example, given checkbox group options "Pregnant," "pregnant," "applicable," corresponding variables chk_preg_0___0, chk_preg_0___1, chk_preg_0____9, assuming -9 specified user missing value. .propagate_checkbox_missings TRUE, chk_preg_0___0 chk_preg_0___1 set -9 chk_preg_0____9 1. Otherwise, columns remain 0 chk_preg_0____9 1.

what: Generate a codebook object from an SPSS dataset — cb_create_spss
title: Generate a codebook object from an SPSS dataset — cb_create_spss
text: cb_create_spss() builds object class "li_codebook" SPSS dataset (imported using haven::read_spss(), read_sav(), read_por()). Metadata including variable labels, value labels, user missing values extracted imported dataset. (User missing values can also set using .user_missing argument.)` resulting object can used write Excel workbook variable data summaries (using cb_write()), extract processed data (cb_get_data()), generate dataset summaries (cb_summarize_numeric() cb_summarize_categorical()).

title: Generate a codebook object from an SPSS dataset — cb_create_spss
code: cb_create_spss(   data,   .user_missing = NULL,   .user_missing_col = c("if_any", "yes", "no"),   .user_missing_conflict = c("val_label", "missing_label"),   .user_missing_incompatible = c("ignore", "warn", "error") )

title: Generate a codebook object from an SPSS dataset — cb_create_spss
text: data data frame exported retrieved REDCap. .user_missing formula list formulas specifying user missing values. Formulas specify variables left-hand side (variable names tidyselect expressions), missing values right-hand side. left-hand side omitted, defaults tidyselect::everything(). See "Specifying user missing values" cb_create() documentation examples. .user_missing_col Include value labels user missing values separate column? default, "if_any", adds column user missings specified least one variable. .user_missing_conflict labels passed .user_missing conflicts value label data, used? .user_missing_incompatible handle variables specified .user_missing compatible user missing values (e.g., logical, Date, POSIXt)?

title: Generate a codebook object from an SPSS dataset — cb_create_spss
text: "li_codebook" object, consisting (1) tibble summarizing passed dataset (2) attributes containing passed dataset (several formats) additional metadata. Specifically: tibble columns: name: variable name type: variable type label: variable label value_labels: value labels user_missing: optional column, depending value .user_missing_col, value labels user missing values missing: proportion missing Attributes: Transformed versions passed dataset. See cb_get_data(). Lookup tables metadata used internally: "user_missing", "vals_by_label", "labs_by_value", "miss_propagate", "factors", "n_obs", "n_vars"#'

what: Extract data from a codebook object — cb_get_data
title: Extract data from a codebook object — cb_get_data
text: Codebook objects created cb_create() friends contain several transformed versions originally passed dataset. can extracted using cb_get_data().

title: Extract data from a codebook object — cb_get_data
Extract data from a codebook object — cb_get_data
text: cb object class "li_codebook" produced cb_create() variant. format Format returned data; see details.

title: Extract data from a codebook object — cb_get_data
text: tibble variables formatted based format argument. format = "values", variables retain values original dataset, including values user missings. data may reflect transformations made variants cb_create() – e.g., cb_create_redcap(), integer coercion propagation user missings across checkbox variables. "haven", value labels user missings encoded using class "haven_labelled"` "factors", variables value labels converted factors, user missings converted NA.

what: Summarize categorical variables from a codebook object — cb_summarize_categorical
title: Summarize categorical variables from a codebook object — cb_summarize_categorical
text: cb_summarize_categorical() generates frequencies table categorical variables codebook object, optionally group. Variables value labels, factors (including ordered factors), logical variables treated categorical.

title: Summarize categorical variables from a codebook object — cb_summarize_categorical
code: cb_summarize_categorical(   cb,   group_by = NULL,   prefixed = TRUE,   detail_missing = missing(group_by),   detail_na_label = "NA" )

title: Summarize categorical variables from a codebook object — cb_summarize_categorical
text: cb object class "li_codebook" produced cb_create() variant. group_by <tidy-select> Column columns group . prefixed value labels prefixed corresponding value? e.g., TRUE yields "[1] Value One"; FALSE yields "Value One". detail_missing Include detailed missing value information? Currently supported grouping variables specified. detail_na_label Label used NA values detail_missing TRUE.

title: Summarize categorical variables from a codebook object — cb_summarize_categorical
text: tibble frequency information categorical variable.

what: Summarize numeric variables from a codebook object — cb_summarize_numeric
title: Summarize numeric variables from a codebook object — cb_summarize_numeric
text: cb_summarize_numeric() generates summary table numeric variables codebook object, optionally group. Future releases include options specify summary statistics used. Currently, summary statistics valid n %; mean SD; median, MAD, min, max, range; skewness, kurtosis.

title: Summarize numeric variables from a codebook object — cb_summarize_numeric
Summarize numeric variables from a codebook object — cb_summarize_numeric
text: cb object class "li_codebook" produced cb_create() variant. group_by <tidy-select> Column columns group .

title: Summarize numeric variables from a codebook object — cb_summarize_numeric
text: tibble summary statistics numeric variable.

what: Write codebook and data summaries to an Excel workbook — cb_write
title: Write codebook and data summaries to an Excel workbook — cb_write
text: cb_write() writes Excel workbook disk tabs including codebook; summary statistics numeric variables; frequencies categorical variables; optional grouped data summaries. data summaires, variables value labels, factors (including ordered factors), logical variables treated categorical, numeric integer variables treated numeric.

title: Write codebook and data summaries to an Excel workbook — cb_write
code: cb_write(   cb,   file,   dataset_name = NULL,   incl_date = TRUE,   incl_dims = TRUE,   group_by = NULL,   detail_missing = TRUE,   overwrite = TRUE )

title: Write codebook and data summaries to an Excel workbook — cb_write
text: cb object class "li_codebook" produced cb_create() variant. file Path write . dataset_name Name dataset display workbook headers. incl_date, incl_dims date /dataset dimensions included Overview tab header? group_by <tidy-select> Column columns group . specified, additional numeric categorical summary tabs included decked heads specified groups. detail_missing Include detailed missing value information categorical summary tab? overwrite Overwrite existing file?

title: Write codebook and data summaries to an Excel workbook — cb_write
text: Invisibly returns path written Excel file.
